metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10142 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's freescale hypervisor managerimplementation, kernel versions 5.0.x up to, excluding 5.0.17. A parameterpassed to an ioctl was incorrectly validated and used in size calculationsfor the page size calculation. An attacker can use this flaw to crash thesystem, corrupt memory, or create other adverse security affects.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-157.185
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-157.185').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
